The data on white versus non-white composers shown in table15.3also reveals the bias of themusical canon. The percentage of non-white composers programmed ranges from  $4.55\%$  (Boston University)to  $13.28\%$  (University of Wisconsin-Madison)withanaverageof  $7.98\%$  non-whitecomposers.Eightof the schools programmed pieces by fewer than tenn on-whitecomposers.Again even the lowest percentage of white composers,  $86.72\%$  ,isstill veryhigh.
